title: [Large-Scale] Creativity Development Through Traditional Music: Guqin Learning and Mathematical Rhythm Pattern Analysis via Systematic Integrated Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Basic traditional instrument performance, comprehension of music theory, proficiency in fraction/decimal operations and basic graph interpretation, and foundational skills in equation formulation and data analysis
context.additional_context: A creativity development program using the UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Guqin instrument. Short workshops for practicing professionals to enhance work extensibility. Focuses on improving pattern recognition, spatial reasoning, and creative problem-solving via music-mathematics integration. Particularly aims to expand mathematical thinking through probabilistic rhythm variations and symmetry analysis.

learning_goals: Over 80% of learners can explain the cultural significance and performance techniques of Guqin by linking them to mathematical ratios (e.g., 3:2 intervals) through equations and graph formats.
All participants can create at least one traditional scale variation composition using VR simulations, express it as fractional/decimal rhythm graphs, and analyze statistical patterns.
Each learner can complete a proof and analysis report on mathematical rhythm patterns (periodicity, symmetry, fractional expressions) utilizing traditional music elements (e.g., pentatonic scales).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
